newsitem.title: INDIA: India castor up on low arrivals, enquiries.
newsitem.headline: India castor up on low arrivals, enquiries.

text.p: Castorseed September delivery lifted further to 1,167/1,168 rupees per quintal from 1,161/1,162 rupees on fresh speculative buying on Monday, dealers said.

A drop in arrivals at producing centres coupled with fresh overseas enquiries prompted continued bull support. Daily average arrivals of castorseed in Gujarat dropped to 4,000/5,000 bags (75 kg each) against the earlier 8,000/10,000 bags.
"The forward market commission has granted permission for December delivery and Bombay traders will commence trading in the December delivery from Tuesday," one operator said.
Groundnut oil looked up from 370/372 rupees to 373/374 rupees per 10 kg on the back of higher physical support for the approaching festival season coupled with a limited inflow of 40/50 tonnes.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was steady at 595 rupees per 15 kg.
In Bombay imported palm-oil rose by 3/4 rupees at 257 rupees per 10 kg on higher outstation buying for the festive season.
Sentiment at the close remained subdued as traders were expecting higher arrivals of imported palm-oil in the coming days at Bombay port.
"Bombay port will receive inflow of 25,000/30,000 tonnes of imported palm-oil during the first two weeks of current month," one importer said.
